intro: Quintinia apoensis, commonly known as the Apo quintinia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its fruit is a small, woody capsule. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
